channel.title: Need help error connecting
channel.description:
i need help on teamviewer if possible every server and client i get i cannot log in (error connecting to server) Things ive done: every server and client i change it to my jdk i change ip to mine i have no-ip i have port forwarded (i have at&t 2wire) i have a host
everything i tried fails.. it does NOT have to go online i want to be able to make it the way i want it before it goes online. i know how to do everything but get my server online. got tips? help please no sarcastic remarks i have tried everything i know i have jdk 7u3 thanks in advance to anyone that can help me ill give you my info for teamviewer that would be greatly appreciated i ONLY want 317 client. ive tried some but i still cant connect to server compiler works and everything just5 wont connect as i just checked on canyouseeme.org i must have portforwarded wrong? but ive done it before and it worked please help.....

item.title: Need help error connecting
item.dc:creator: @Nicksworld Nicksworld
item.description:
@Nicksworld wrote:

step 1:Go to your client.java do crtl f search for server = make sures its 127.0.0.1

ps:and you dont use the no-ip for you to connect you need to use the local host which is 127.0.0.1 or 0.0.0.0 which ever you happen to prefer i use 127.0.0.1.also no-ip goes where the 127.0.0.1 goes when your ready for people to play it redo
step 1 up to server = 127.0.0.1 or server = 0.0.0.0

step 2:make sure both the ports are 43594 this is often a big mess up and make sure the source cmd reads thats its connected to 127.0.0.1 and port 43594

step 3: when your are ready for players do client.java ctrl f and find server = change it to your no-ip.

step 4:if you still need help message me ill give it a try over team viewer

step 5:you should rep to me if this helped you out not asking for it but it would be nice.Hope this helped

no milk and cookies for you till you fix your server

Read full topic

item.title: Need help error connecting
item.dc:creator: @yodead yodead
item.description:
@yodead wrote:

Have you made sure you were actually portforwarded. Because my router requires upnp to be on. You might want to check that by going to Google and Aeschylus canyouseeme

Read full topic

Did you open the DUC and put your host address in the client and server then compile an run?

ive tried everything and it wont work.
